scene.name: intro
scene.line: Ma'am, I hate to say it, but the cupboard is bare.
Have some vision, cricket. We've got â€” one, two ... four patrons.
Well, we've done more with less.
scene.option: What kind of music do you play?
I haven't been in a bar like this since ...

scene.name: about-music
scene.line: It's like Cyrano Cole meets Ike Towner, but with a woman lead, and the keyboards are kind of ambient whisperwave.
There's some Dolly Crown in there, too. Like the early stuff before she joined the Sheet Swingers.
scene.option: I don't know who those people are.

scene.name: music-get-it
scene.line: I think he gets it, ma'am.

scene.name: music-confused
scene.line: Well, you'll hear it in a minute.

scene.name: play-often
scene.line: We have a regular thing here. Harry likes to just book it all up and forget about it. He's not really a music lover, I wouldn't say, but I guess his wife was. She had this stage put in, I know that. So he keeps it going. In her memory or out of habit.

scene.name: conway-bar
scene.line: Gave it up, huh? Well I bet Harry has some coffee on back there, but I won't vouch for quality.
Johnny's favorite regional cuisine is "gas station."
